analytic.title: The Role of the Women in the Early Greek and Syriac Churches

biblStruct.note: "The question of women's leadership in the ancient churches has figured largely in the debates over what roles should be extended to women within the contemporary churches. Central to this debate is question about the interpretation of ancient texts. By now there is considerable sophistication in the historical interpretation of theological arguments in ancient texts. Attention is paid to the wider range of meanings of the theological vocabulary that is used. The logical structure of arguments is interpreted with reference to the forms of logic developing within contemporary philosophical schools." The "oikos-polis" system. The honor-shame system. (p. 135)
